jpo
Class JpegSegmentReader

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--jpo.JpegSegmentReader
public class JpegSegmentReader
extends Object

Performs read functions of Jpeg files, returning specific file segments. TODO add a findAvailableSegments() method TODO add more segment identifiers TODO add a getSegmentDescription() method, returning for example 'App1 application data segment, commonly containing Exif data'

Author:
Drew Noakes http://drewnoakes.com

          The BufferedInputStream from which to decode the segments

Parameters:

Creates a JpegSegmentReader for a specific BufferedInputStream

Parameters:
bis - the BufferedInputStream to read segements from
Method Detail

isJpeg

public boolean isJpeg()
               throws IOException
Determines if the file passed to the constructor of this class is a Jpeg file. Note that this implementation simply checks the magic number, and doesn't detect corrupt files.

Returns:
true, if a legal jpeg file, otherwise false
Throws:
IOException - for any problem in reading the file

isValidJpegHeaderBytes

private boolean isValidJpegHeaderBytes(InputStream fileStream)
                                throws IOException
Helper method that validates the Jpeg file's magic number.

Parameters:
fileStream - the InputStream to read bytes from, which must be positioned at its start (i.e. no bytes read yet)
Returns:
true if the magic number is Jpeg (0xFFD8)
Throws:
IOException - for any problem in reading the file

readSegment

public byte[] readSegment(int segmentMarker)
                   throws JpegProcessingException
Reads the first instance of a given Jpeg segment, returning the contents as a byte array. TODO allow user to specify the subsequent instances of a segment marker, or return a 2D array (overload of method)

Parameters:
segmentMarker - the byte identifier for the desired segment
Returns:
the byte array if found, else null
Throws:
JpegProcessingException - for any problems processing the Jpeg data, including inner IOExceptions
